channel.title: A Riddle For You
channel.description:
[s][s]Two coins add up to 30 cents, and one of them is not a nickel. What are they? NO CHEATING, FUTURE JANITORS![/s] [s]1)theres a hole, its 3feet wide, and 9feet deep, how much dirt is in the hole?
2)you eat over 100 pounds of dirt each day, how is this?
3)You throw away the outside and cook the inside. Then you eat the outside and throw away the inside. What did you eat?
4)What 7 letter word becomes longer when the third letter is removed?
5)What comes twice in a week but once in a year? You are in a museum, and you look at the exhibits. You see: 1) A ring claimed to belong to Julius Caesar. 2) A coin with 100 BC engraved onto it. 3) A jar with King Tut's heart. One of these is fake. Which one is it?[/s] [s]King Tut died 120 years after King Eros was born. Their combined ages when they died was 100 years. King Eros died in the year 40 B.C. In what year was King Tut born? A man is found lying dead, face down in the middle of the desert.
He is wearing a backpack.
His ribs are crushed.
The post mortem shows that he died, suddenly, 2 months ago.
Yet no one has crossed the dessert for 3 months.
What happened?[/s] Two convicts are locked in a cell.
There is an unbarred window high up in the cell.
No matter if they stand on the bed or one on top of the other they can't reach the window to escape.
They then decide to tunnel out.
However, they give up with the tunnelling because it will take too long.
Finally one of the convicts figures out how to escape from the cell.
What is his plan?
[/s] Check back tomorrow.

item.title: A Riddle For You
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:11, topic:204233”][quote author=cooper link=topic=269720.msg2215612#msg2215612 date=1210138752]
A man is found lying dead, face down in the middle of the desert.

He is wearing a backpack.

His ribs are crushed.

The post mortem shows that he died, suddenly, 2 months ago.

Yet no one has crossed the dessert for 3 months.

What happened?
[/quote]

He fell out of a plane and forgot to deploy his parachute?[/quote]
Yep!

Read full topic

item.title: A Riddle For You
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[s]Two coins add up to 30 cents, and one of them is not a nickel. What are they?
NO CHEATING, FUTURE JANITORS!
[s]1)theres a hole, its 3feet wide, and 9feet deep, how much dirt is in the hole?

2)you eat over 100 pounds of dirt each day, how is this?

3)You throw away the outside and cook the inside. Then you eat the outside and throw away the inside. What did you eat?

4)What 7 letter word becomes longer when the third letter is removed?

5)What comes twice in a week but once in a year?
You are in a museum, and you look at the exhibits. You see:

  1. A ring claimed to belong to Julius Caesar.
  2. A coin with 100 BC engraved onto it.
  3. A jar with King Tut’s heart.
    One of these is fake. Which one is it?[/s]
    [s]King Tut died 120 years after King Eros was born. Their combined ages when they died was 100 years. King Eros died in the year 40 B.C. In what year was King Tut born?
    A man is found lying dead, face down in the middle of the desert.

He is wearing a backpack.

His ribs are crushed.

The post mortem shows that he died, suddenly, 2 months ago.

Yet no one has crossed the dessert for 3 months.

What happened?[/s]
Two convicts are locked in a cell.

There is an unbarred window high up in the cell.

No matter if they stand on the bed or one on top of the other they can’t reach the window to escape.

They then decide to tunnel out.

However, they give up with the tunnelling because it will take too long.

Finally one of the convicts figures out how to escape from the cell.

What is his plan?

[/s]
Check back tomorrow.
